snippet: President Obama said the Republican budget would deepen inequality in the United States, part of an indictment of the party that included his likely opponent in the fall, Mitt Romney.
abstract: President Obama condemns federal budget adopted by House Republicans, saying it would greatly deepen inequality in the United States; paints it as the manifesto of a party that has swung radically to the right; attack is part of an indictment of the GOP that includes Mitt Romney, his likely opponent in the fall.
lead_paragraph: President Obama said the Republican budget would deepen inequality in the United States, part of an indictment of the party that included his likely opponent in the fall, Mitt Romney.

headline.main: Obama, in Talk, Calls House G.O.P. Budget the Work of Rightist Radicals
headline.print_headline: Obama, in Talk, Calls House G.O.P. Budget the Work of Rightist Radicals
